com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.layeredvideo

Class PlaybackControlLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.libraries.mediaframework.layeredvideo.PlaybackControlLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlayerControlCallback, Layer

    public class PlaybackControlLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Layer, PlayerControlCallback
    A Layer that creates a customizable view for controlling video playback.

    The view consists of:

    1) a top chrome which contains a logo, title, and set of action buttons.

    2) a bottom chrome which contains a seek bar, fullscreen button, and text views indicating the current time and total duration of the video.

    3) a translucent middle section which displays a pause/play button.

    The view appears when the container containing the PlaybackControlLayer is tapped. It automatically disappears after a given time.

    The view can be customized by:

    1) Setting the color of the top chrome, bottom chrome, and background - this is called the chrome tint color.

    2) Setting the color of the text - this is called the text color.

    3) Setting the color of the buttons and seek bar - this is called the control tint color.

    4) Setting the logo image displayed in the left of the top chrome.

    5) Setting the title of the video displayed in the left of the top chrome (and to the right of the logo).

    6) Adding an action button by providing an image, a content description, and a click handler. If there is enough room, the action buttons will be displayed on the right of the top chrome. If there is NOT enough room, an overflow button will be displayed. When the overflow button is clicked, a dialog box listing the content descriptions for the action buttons is displayed. The action is then triggered by selecting it from the dialog box.

    The view is defined in the layout file: res/layout/playback_control_layer.xml.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback
      In order to imbue the PlaybackControlLayer with the ability make the player fullscreen, a PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback must be assigned to it.
      private static class  PlaybackControlLayer.MessageHandler
      Message handler which allows us to send delayed messages to the PlaybackControlLayer This is useful for fading out the view after a certain time.

      • canSeek

        private boolean canSeek
        Whether the user can drag the seek bar thumb to seek.

      • chromeColor

        private int chromeColor

        Derived from the Color class (ex. Color#RED), the chrome consists of three views, which are are tinted with the the chrome color.

        The views are:

        1) The top chrome which contains the logo, title, and action buttons.

        2) The bottom chrome which contains the play/pause button, seek bar, and fullscreen buttons.

        3) The translucent middle section of the PlaybackControlLayer.

        The chromeColor changes the color of each of these elements.

      • controlColor

        private int controlColor
        Derived from the Color class (ex Color#RED), this is the color of the play/pause button, fullscreen button, seek bar, and action buttons.

      • textColor

        private int textColor
        Derived from the Color class (ex Color#RED), this is the color of the text views.

      • seekbarColor

        private int seekbarColor
        Derived from the Color class (ex Color#RED), this is the color of the seekbar track and thumb.

      • currentTime

        private TextView currentTime
        Displays the elapsed time into video.

      • endTime

        private TextView endTime
        Displays the duration of the video.

      • fullscreenButton

        private ImageButton fullscreenButton
        Makes player enter or leave fullscreen. This button is not displayed unless there is a PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback associated with this object.

      • fullscreenCallback

        private PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback fullscreenCallback
        This callback is triggered when going to fullscreen and returning from fullscreen.

      • handler

        private Handler handler
        The message handler which deals with displaying progress and fading out the media controls We use it so that we can make the view fade out after a timeout (by sending a delayed message).

      • isFullscreen

        private boolean isFullscreen
        Whether the player is currently in fullscreen mode.

        Whether the seekbar is currently being dragged.

      • logoDrawable

        private Drawable logoDrawable
        The drawable that will be displayed in the logoImageView.

      • logoImageView

        private ImageView logoImageView
        Displayed in the left of the top chrome - shows a logo. This is optional; if no image is provided, then no logo will be displayed.

      • originalContainerLayoutParams

        private ViewGroup.LayoutParams originalContainerLayoutParams
        This is the layout of the container before fullscreen mode has been entered. When we leave fullscreen mode, we restore the layout of the container to this layout.

      • actionButtonsContainer

        private LinearLayout actionButtonsContainer
        Contains the actions buttons (displayed in right of the top chrome).

      • pausePlayButton

        private ImageButton pausePlayButton
        Displays the play icon when the video is playing, or the pause icon when the video is playing.

      • seekBar

        private SeekBar seekBar
        Displays a track and a thumb which can be used to seek to different time points in the video.

      • shouldBePlaying

        private boolean shouldBePlaying
        Whether the play button has been pressed and the video should be playing. We include this variable because the video may pause when buffering must occur. Although the video will usually resume automatically when the buffering is complete, there are instances (i.e. ad playback), where it will not resume automatically. So, if we detect that the video is paused after buffering and should be playing, we can resume it programmatically.

      • timeFormat

        private java.lang.StringBuilder timeFormat
        Encodes the HH:MM:SS or MM:SS time format.

      • timeFormatter

        private java.util.Formatter timeFormatter
        Formats times to HH:MM:SS or MM:SS form.

      • topChrome

        private RelativeLayout topChrome
        Contains the logo, video title, and other actions button. It can be tinted with a color for branding.

      • playbackControlRootView

        private FrameLayout playbackControlRootView
        This is the root view which contains all other views that make up the playback control layer. It can be tinted by setting the chrome color.

      • bottomChrome

        private LinearLayout bottomChrome
        Contains the seek bar, current time, end time, and fullscreen button. The background can be tinted with a color for branding.

      • videoTitle

        private java.lang.String videoTitle
        The title displayed in the videoTitleView.

      • videoTitleView

        private TextView videoTitleView
        Video title displayed in the left of the top chrome.

      • view

        private FrameLayout view
        The view created by this PlaybackControlLayer

    • Method Detail

      • addActionButton

        public void addActionButton(Activity activity,
                   Drawable icon,
                   java.lang.String contentDescription,
                   View.OnClickListener onClickListener)
        Creates a button to put in the set of action buttons at the right of the top chrome.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that contains the video player.
        icon - The image of the action (ex. trash can).
        contentDescription - The text description this action. This is used in case the action buttons do not fit in the video player. If so, an overflow button will appear and, when clicked, it will display a list of the content descriptions for each action.
        onClickListener - The handler for when the action is triggered.

      • createView

        public FrameLayout createView(LayerManager layerManager)
        Description copied from interface: Layer
        Builds and sets up the view that will be layered onto the video player. The returned view must be a FrameLayout to ensure that the LayerManager can overlay it on top of the other layers.
        Specified by:
        createView in interface Layer
        Parameters:
        layerManager - The LayerManager which will contain this layer.
        Returns:
        The view to be layered onto the video player by the LayerManager

      • disableSeeking

        public void disableSeeking()
        Hides the seek bar thumb and prevents the user from seeking to different time points in the video.

      • doToggleFullscreen

        public void doToggleFullscreen()
        Fullscreen mode will rotate to landscape mode, hide the action bar, hide the navigation bar, hide the system tray, and make the video player take up the full size of the display. The developer who is using this function must ensure the following:

        1) Inside the android manifest, the activity that uses the video player has the attribute android:configChanges="orientation".

        2) Other views in the activity (or fragment) are hidden (or made visible) when this method is called.

      • enableSeeking

        public void enableSeeking()
        Makes the seek bar thumb visible and allows the user to seek to different time points in the video.

      • getLayerManager

        public LayerManager getLayerManager()
        Returns the LayerManager which is responsible for displaying this layer's view.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Fades the playback control layer out and then removes it from the LayerManager's container.

      • show

        public void show(int timeout)
        Add the playback control layer back to the container. The playback controls disappear after timeout milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Hide the view after timeout milliseconds. If timeout == 0, then the playback controls will not disappear unless their container is tapped again.

      • show

        public void show()
        Add the playback control layer back to the container. It will disappear when the user taps the screen.

      • hideTopChrome

        public void hideTopChrome()
        Hides the top chrome (which displays the logo, title, and action buttons).

      • showTopChrome

        public void showTopChrome()
        Shows the top chrome (which displays the logo, title, and action buttons).

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns whether the player is currently in fullscreen mode.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean shouldBeFullscreen)
        Make the player enter or leave fullscreen mode.
        Parameters:
        shouldBeFullscreen - If true, the player is put into fullscreen mode. If false, the player leaves fullscreen mode.

        public void setFullscreenCallback(PlaybackControlLayer.FullscreenCallback fullscreenCallback)
        Set the callback which will be called when the player enters and leaves fullscreen mode.
        Parameters:
        fullscreenCallback - The callback should hide other views in the activity when the player enters fullscreen mode and show other views when the player leaves fullscreen mode.

      • setPlayPause

        public void setPlayPause(boolean shouldPlay)
        Play or pause the player.
        Parameters:
        shouldPlay - If true, then the player starts playing. If false, the player pauses.

      • setVideoTitle

        public void setVideoTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Set the title of the video in the left of the top chrome (to the right of the logo).
        Parameters:
        title - The video title. If it is too long, it will be ellipsized.

      • setupView

        private void setupView()
        Perform binding to UI, setup of event handlers and initialization of values.

      • shouldBePlaying

        public boolean shouldBePlaying()
        Returns whether the player should be playing (based on whether the user has tapped pause or play). This can be used by other classes to look at the playback control layer's play/pause state and force the player to play or pause accordingly.

      • stringForTime

        public java.lang.String stringForTime(int timeMs)
        Format the milliseconds to HH:MM:SS or MM:SS format.

      • togglePlayPause

        public void togglePlayPause()
        If the player is paused, play it and if the player is playing, pause it.

      • updateActionButtons

        public void updateActionButtons()
        The action buttons are displayed in the top right of the video player. If the player is in portrait mode, then display an overflow button which displays a dialog window containing the possible actions. If the player is in landscape, then display the images for the actions in the top right of the video player.

      • updateColors

        public void updateColors()
        Ensure that the chrome, control, and text colors displayed on the screen are correct.

      • updatePlayPauseButton

        public void updatePlayPauseButton()
        Change the icon of the play/pause button to indicate play or pause based on the state of the video player.

      • updateProgress

        public int updateProgress()
        Adjust the position of the action bar to reflect the progress of the video.
